name: mufti
content:
mufti noun
(CLOTHES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] old-fashioned ordinary clothes worn by people who usually wear either uniforms or special clothes for work or sports: The admiral arrived in mufti. On mufti days, pupils can wear their own clothes in return for paying a small fee to a charity.
More examplesFewer examplesAn officer wears mufti only when he's outside the camp.The other players had him go up to collect the FA Cup in mufti.The others are still in mufti - labourers in soiled overalls, farmers in field clothes, office workers in ready-made suits and starched collars.

mufti noun
(RELIGIOUS LEADER)
[ C ] a Muslim legal expert who makes decisions based on religious laws: As a mufti, he is entitled to issue fatwas based on Islamic law. The Mufti of Australia recited from the Holy Koran.
More examplesFewer examplesSunni jurists, or muftis, are said only to apply the law, not to interpret it.Some critics of the mufti argue that he has allowed religion to encroach on civic life.If the local or regional muftis fail to deal with the issue, an inspector will be dispatched from the capital to restore order.
